content:
Many users of Cox have been reporting issues lately.

I'm not familiar with those specific issues, but you might try

  • Start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
  • Still In Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Does problem change? (many users have found antivirus software causing problems)
creator: wsmwk

content:
A couple of things that I think thing that I think may be relevant:

1. Do I need to just install TB on the new machine or actually also start it up as well (this will mean adding a mail account)

2. win TB on win 11, the folder name is "thunderbird" with a lower case "t" instead of upper case as with win 10

3. on win 11, there are now two profile folders "ef6y3gq3.default" and "t2xlde1n.default-release" where win 10 onnly had 1

content: Worked this one out by copying the folder from the old machine (it's more than 2GB, so I couldn't use "export" to make a zip) and then using "import" on the new machine. Worked fine except that it didn't seem to recognise the folders any more so I had to edit all of my filters
